required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Predictive Genetic Testing on Quality of Life and Health-related Behaviour

brief_summary.textblock: Analysing Impact of preemptive genetic testing on quality of life, physical activity and eating behavior at baseline and 3 months after testing.

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life assessed by the SF-36 questionnaire [followed by its scale information in the Description]
primary_outcome.description: Short form (36) (SF-36) questionnaire evaluates health related quality of life (Scale 0-100)

primary_outcome.measure: Physical activity assessed by the IPAQ questionnaire [followed by its scale information in the Description]
primary_outcome.description: International Physical Activity Questionnaire (IPAQ) evaluates physical activity in MET(metabolic equivalent)/min/week

primary_outcome.measure: Eating behavior assessed by the modified LEI questionnaire [followed by its scale information in the Description]
primary_outcome.description: The modified Luzerner Ernaehrungs Index (LEI) questionnaire evaluates eating behavior at lunch (Scale 1-4 per item; 1=never; 4=daily)

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with check up and genetic testing: Likert scale (1-10)

intervention.intervention_name: Routine check up including genetic testing
intervention.description: Intervention is a routine check up including preemptive genetic testing

study_pop.textblock: Healthy subjects with request for health check up at Robert-Bosch-Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥18 years
- informed consent for genetic testing
- informed consent for study participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- renal replacement dependency
- pregnancy
- active cancer disease
- no informed consent for genetic testing or study participation

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Prof. Dr. med. Mark Dominik Alscher
